text: Meet is an early Australian television series which aired on ABC during 1957. The series consisted of interviews in a 15-minute time-slot, with a single person interviewed in each episode. It aired live in Melbourne, with telerecordings (also known as kinescope recordings) made of the broadcasts so it could be shown in Sydney. In Melbourne it aired on Mondays. Following the end of the series, it was followed up with an interview series titled People. Those who were interviewed in the series included Anona Winn,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=HzBVAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=H5UDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3932%2C2632944 Hal Gye,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=JDBVAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=H5UDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3938%2C3329688 Samuel Wadhams,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=-1QRAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=ppUDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3791%2C348342 Alan Marshall,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=AVURAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=ppUDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3797%2C1328996 Ian Clunies- Ross,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=B1URAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=ppUDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3670%2C2351599 Myra Roper,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=DVURAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=ppUDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3772%2C3342067 John Bechervaise,https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=ozNVAAAAIBAJ&sjid;=2ZQDAAAAIBAJ&pg;=3601%2C897841 among others. A search of the National Archives of Australia website suggests that at least two of the episodes still exist despite the wiping of the era. These episodes are the interviews with Ian Clunies-Ross and Vance Palmer. ==References== ==External links== *Meet on IMDb Category:1957 Australian television series debuts Category:1957 Australian television series endings Category:Australian non-fiction television series Category:Black-and-white Australian television shows Category:Australian live television series Category:Australian television talk shows Category:Australian Broadcasting Corporation original programming Category:English-language television shows
title: Meet (TV series)
